info.description:
In order to use the Direct Freight API please first contact us to get an API Token. 
This token needs to be sent as a HTTP header argument in every request to our API.

api-token="SECRET KEY"

Please keep your api-token a secret. If the token is compromised please contact us to get a new one.

This api token authenticates your application and gives it access to the API.

The API token should not be confused with the end-user-token. 
The end-user-token is given to you via the end_user_authentications endpoint when the user logs in. 
The end-user-token is needed in order to use certain features, and get certain sensitive information.

Both Tokens are stateless, and delivered via the HTTP headers.
info.title: Direct Freight API

error_422.description: Unprocessable Entity. More information provided in the return object.

object_created.description: Object created check the headers for a reference URL.

x-code-samples.source: Method not supported

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.directfreight.com/v1/alerts/loads"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("X-RESTLET", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("Accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("Content-Type", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("api-token", "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.customMethod("X-RESTLET","https://api.directfreight.com/v1/alerts/loads")
  .header("Accept", "application/json")
  .header("Content-Type", "application/json")
  .header("api-token", "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE")
  .asString();

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.directfreight.com/v1/alerts/loads",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,

    "Accept: application/json",
    "Content-Type: application/json",
    "api-token: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'

class Net::HTTP::X-restlet < Net::HTTPRequest
  METHOD = 'X-RESTLET'
  REQUEST_HAS_BODY = 'false'
  RESPONSE_HAS_BODY = true
end

url = URI("https://api.directfreight.com/v1/alerts/loads")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::X-restlet.new(url)
request["Accept"] = 'application/json'
request["Content-Type"] = 'application/json'
request["api-token"] = 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

curl --request X-RESTLET \
  --url https://api.directfreight.com/v1/alerts/loads \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --header 'api-token: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

http X-RESTLET https://api.directfreight.com/v1/alerts/loads \
  Accept:application/json \
  Content-Type:application/json \
  api-token:REPLACE_KEY_VALUE

wget --verbose \
  --method X-RESTLET \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --header 'api-token: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --output-document \
  - https://api.directfreight.com/v1/alerts/loads

x-code-samples.source:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.directfreight.com/v1/boards/loads"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"alert_id\":1155,\"company_name\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"destination_city\":\"chicago\",\"destination_radius\":100,\"destination_state\":[\"IL\",\"HI\",\"NY\",\"KS\",\"TX\",\"MO\",\"AL\"],\"full_load\":true,\"google_recaptcha_score\":0,\"item_count\":25,\"max_length\":300,\"max_weight\":40000,\"md5\":\"850FBE52A5345119FD9C79FDE4E27308\",\"min_length\":15,\"min_weight\":1000,\"origin_city\":\"Kansas City\",\"origin_radius\":150,\"origin_state\":[\"MO\",\"IL\",\"TX\",\"CA\"],\"page_number\":0,\"partner\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"return_count\":false,\"return_only\":\"unviewed\",\"return_web_url\":false,\"sort_direction\":\"asc\",\"sort_parameter\":\"age\",\"tier\":\"all\",\"trailer_type\":[\"F\",\"F+T\",\"F+S\",\"V\"]}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("Accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("Content-Type", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("end-user-token", "01234567890abc")
	req.Header.Add("x-dont-update-user-last-date", "NO DEFAULT")
	req.Header.Add("api-token", "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

request(options, function (error, response, body) {

});

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.directfreight.com/v1/end_user_authentication/users"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"email\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"password\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("Accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("Content-Type", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("api-token", "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.directfreight.com/v1/end_user_authentications"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"login\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"realm\":\"username\",\"secret\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("Accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("Content-Type", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("api-token", "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

  .asString();

get.description: A string of a partial city or state name, and returns a list of possible matches.

parameters.description: City or State or Postal code to search for.   It matches city name and state name and state abbreviation.  So for instance "MO" would return Missouri, Montana, and Montreal, QC  while  ME would return Maine, Mexico, and Memphis, TN
parameters.name: searchtext

parameters.description: restricts the results return.  regions will only return states, provinces, and countries.  cities will only return cities and postals.  The default is to return both cities and regions in the results.
parameters.name: return_only

parameters.description: The number of records to return.   Limit 1 has a special property where it will only return a high confidence match so it may return zero results if no match found.
parameters.name: limit

package main

	"fmt"

)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.directfreight.com/v1/profiles"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"address\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"city\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"company\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"contact_extension\":0,\"contact_name\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"contact_number\":0,\"dispatch_extension\":0,\"dispatch_number\":0,\"dot_number\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"driver_per_mile\":0,\"fax_number\":0,\"fuel_capacity\":0,\"ins_permits_per_mile\":0,\"maint_per_mile\":0,\"mc_number\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"miles_per_gal\":0,\"mobile_carrier\":\"Other/Unknown\",\"mobile_number\":0,\"state\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"truck_ownership_per_mile\":0,\"web_page\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\",\"zip\":\"<ADD EXAMPLE VALUE>\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("Accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("Content-Type", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("end-user-token", "NO DEFAULT")
	req.Header.Add("api-token", "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE")

alert_list.description: A hash containing a list of objects. Each entry should have 1 alert object, and 1 search object, and 2 integer counts. One for the number of new loads, and one for the number of total loads that match the search critera.

alert_active.description: Identifies whether an alert meets the criteria to send notifications by one of the notification methods.  Alert activation is  primarily controlled by the datetime field expires_after.  This field is a convenience method to eliminate the need to determine the users time zone and verify server time.

days_of_week.description: Limit the days that alerts are sent to the days listed.

end_hour.description: A  corresponding to the hour of the day.

expires_after.description: The last day the alert will be valid. Valid time frames are from today until one year into the future.

last_modified.description: The last time this alert was modified.

last_search.description: The last time this alert was used in a boards request.

last_sent.description: The last time this alert was sent.

list_type.description: This specify the type of list that is returned, including disabling the list from being sent at all. Valid values are 'complete-list','only-new', 'only-new-free' and 'not-active'.

minute_frequency.description: How many minutes to wait before sending another alert. Valid values are '15','30','60','120','240','480', and '1440'.

previous_search.description: The second to last time this alert was used in a boards request.

search.description: Refer to the boards documentation for the full list of restrictions for each field.

send_type.description: What method to send the alert list.

start_hour.description: A  corresponding to the hour of the day.

time_zone.description: A number between -1 and 2. -1 = EST, 0 = CST, 1 = MST, 2 = PST

alert_id.description: Allowed as a convenience to create consistency with a boards request, but is ignored during alert creation.

days_of_week.description: Limit the days that alerts are sent to the days listed.

end_hour.description: A  corresponding to the hour of the day. (This field will accept 23 however there is a known logic issue for values over 21 with time zone set to 2)

expires_after.description: The last day and time the alert will be valid. Valid time frames are from today until one year into the future.  This field will accept date only or a date and time.  If the date only is submitted the time will default to 23:59:59

item_count.description: Allowed as a convenience to create consistency with a boards request, but is ignored during alert creation.

list_type.description: This specify the type of list that is returned, including disabling the list from being sent at all. Valid values are 'complete-list','only-new', 'only-new-free' and 'not-active'.

minute_frequency.description: How many minutes to wait before sending another alert. Valid values are '15','30','60','120','240','480', and '1440'.

page_number.description: Allowed as a convenience to create consistency with a boards request, but is ignored during alert creation.

return_count.description: Allowed as a convenience to create consistency with a boards request, but is ignored during alert creation.

search.description: Refer to the boards documentation for the full list of restrictions for each field.

return_only.description: Allowed as a convenience to create consistency with a boards request, but is ignored during alert creation.

tier.description: Allowed as a convenience to create consistency with a boards request, but is ignored during alert creation.

send_type.description: What method to send the alert list.

start_hour.description: A  corresponding to the hour of the day.  (This field will accept 23 however there is a known logic issue for values over 21 with time zone set to 2)

time_zone.description: A number between -1 and 2. -1 = EST, 0 = CST, 1 = MST, 2 = PST

city.description: The name of the city.  Only returned if record_type is city or postal

postal_code.description: The postal code of the city.  Only returned if match type is postal.

alert_id.description: By specifying an alert_id we will record the loads or trucks seen by this user, and associate it with their alert.   See /alerts documentation for more information on setting up alerts.

destination_city.description: If used, this field must be accompanied by a destination_state.

destination_radius.description: If both the destination city and state are specified, this field will limit the search to results to within # miles of the specified destination city.   If this field is omitted during a search that includes a destination city a default value of 30 miles will be used.

destination_state.description: If the destination_city field is is used, this field should contain the state for that city.  For searches without a specified destination_city this field may contain an array list of state abbreviations.

full_load.description: This is only valid when requesting a loads board. Omitting this field will return both full and partial loads. A true value will limit results to full loads only.  False will return partial loads only.

item_count.description: This argument adjusts how many items per page will be returned.  Omitting this field will return the default of 50 items per page

max_length.description: Return items no longer than this.

max_weight.description: Return items that weight less than this.

min_length.description: Return items at least this long.

min_weight.description: Return items that weight at least this much.

origin_city.description: If used, this field must be accompanied by an origin_state.

origin_radius.description: If both the origin city and state are specified, this field will limit the search to results to within # miles of the specified origin city. If this field is omitted during a search that includes an origin city a default value of 25 miles will be used.

origin_state.description: If the origin_city field is is used, this field should contain the state for that city. For searches without a specified origin_city this field may contain an array list of state abbreviations.

page_number.description: The page you want to return. Will return an empty board on an invalid page.

partner.description: Used to customize API response for integration partners. This field should only be used in coordination with developers at Direct Freight Services

return_count.description: If included this will return a total count instead of a list.

return_web_url.description: If included this will return a "search_url" property that has a URL that can be used to perform this same search on the DirectFreight Website.

ship_date.description: Limits results to specified ship date(s).

sort_direction.description: The system automatically chooses the most common order based on the parameter chosen. Use this option if you want a specific sort direction.

sort_parameter.description: The system automatically chooses the most common order based on the parameter chosen.  Sort order can be specified by using the "sort_direction" parameter.

trailer_type.description: A string array of valid trailer types to limit the search.

age.description: Time in minutes since load/truck was first posted. NULL is returned for values less than 1 minute.

comment.description: This field is only returned for an end_user_token that has the subscribed access level.

company_name.description: This field is only returned for an end_user_token that has the subscribed access level.

credit_report_key.description:
This field is only returned for an end_user_token that has the subscribed access level.

To access the credit report associated with the company for this item, use the key returned with the following url. https://www.directfreight.com/home/credit_report?refid=$credit_report_key

credit_score.description: The credit score for the company associated with this item.

dead_head.description: Distance between request body origin_city, and response item origin_city. This field will be null if no origin_city is specified in the request body or if distance cannot be calculated.

destination_city.description: This field may be returned as null.

destination_state.description: This field may be returned as null.

full_load.description: Specifies whether load is full or partial.  Will always return true for trucks.

green_light.description: Indicates whether broker/shipper for item is pre-approved for Rivera Finance factoring program.

height.description: Height in inches.  Will be null if empty.

length.description: Length in feet.  Will be null if empty.

phone_extension.description: This field is only returned for an end_user_token that has the subscribed access level.   Will return null if empty.

phone_number.description: This field is only returned for an end_user_token that has the subscribed access level.

ship_date.description: The date the load is scheduled to be picked up.  For trucks this is the date the truck is available.

tags.description: Indicates special characteristics of a load record.  This field may be returned as a blank array.  Currently (new) is the only value that will be returned.

trailer_type.description: A string array of valid trailer types.

trip_miles.description: Distance between origin and destination.  This field will be null if distance cannot be calculated.

user_hid.description: This field is only returned for an end_user_token that has the subscribed or posting access level. The value when true represents that the user wishes the entry hidden. Refer to boards/hidden_entries/ documentation for more information on how to set and update this value.

weight.description: Weight in pounds.  Will be null if empty.

width.description: Width in inches.  Will be null if empty.

list.description: A list of entries for this board.

search_url.description: URL that can be used to perform this same search on the DirectFreight Website. Will only be returned if return_web_url is requested.

total_items.description: A count of all the entry objects for the specified search.

total_pages.description: A count of the # of pages based on the search parameters.

example.executive_summary: Based on all of the information we have about your truck and this load we believe this load would have a net profit of $-736.27 after you paid the driver(yourself) and all of the expenses. Fuel costs vary across your route you might consider buying fuel in MO, where fuel costs are $0.458 lower than the average fuel price along this route.

destination_city.description: Origin City, returned as a convinience.

destination_state.description: Two letter origin state abbreviation, returned as a convinience.

fuel_cost.description: Estimated cost of fuel.  fuel_used x avg_fuel_price_trip

origin_city.description: Origin City, returned as a convinience.

origin_state.description: Two letter origin state abbreviation, returned as a convinience.

pay_rate.description: Returned as a convenience or "N/A" if value was not submitted.

rate_per_mile_est.description: Calculated using the same method as a boards load request.

trip_miles.description: Calculated distance, same value as when load was posted.

avg_fuel_price_trip.description: Simple avgerage of all state average fuel prices for trip.  Does not account for miles traveled in each state.

entry_id.description: The entry to associate the note with.

end-user-token.description: On success an end-user-token is returned.

lists.description: A list of each custom field, type and it's corresponding position.
A list of each custom field, type and it's corresponding position.

exists.description: Returns a true value if it is associated with an account.

company_name.description: A subset of companies that need to be marked as hidden.

entry_id.description: A subset of entries that need to be marked as hidden.
The entry(s) that need to be marked as hidden.

login.description: The e-mail, or username information needed to log in.

realm.description: This specifies who to log in with. If left blank we will assume email/password. Valid realms are username, email, facebook(not implemneted), google(not implemented), and linkedin(not implemented).

secret.description: The password, or token required for this login.

company_name.description: The company that need to be marked as hidden.

date_added.description: The date the note was created.

date_modified.description: Date of the last update to this note

deleted.description: Not sure what this field is?  Is this the date the note was deleted or the status of the load?

entry_id.description: Entry id of the load associated with this note.

alert_id.description: Specify which alert you are updating.

days_of_week.description: Limit the days that alerts are sent to the days listed.

end_hour.description: A value corresponding to the hour of the day.

expires_after.description: The last day the alert will be valid. Valid time frames are from today until one year into the future. Cannot be changed if alert is inactive.

list_type.description: This specify the type of list that is returned, including disabling the list from being sent at all.

minute_frequency.description: How many minutes to wait before sending another alert.

send_type.description: What method to send the alert list.

start_hour.description: A value corresponding to the hour of the day.

time_zone.description: A number between -1 and 2. -1 = EST, 0 = CST, 1 = MST, 2 = PST

optin_code.description: A text string with the code sent.

new_load_custom_id.description: Optionally specify the custom_id that should be assigned to the new load. This is required for the copy command, for the move command it will be auto-generated if one is not specified.

source_id.description: The posting id of the posting you are moving or copying. Optional for create.

source_posting.description: The posting_type where you are moving or copying the posting from. Optional for create. Items can only be moved to like types. loads -> private_private loads.

list.description: A list of posting objects you can iterate over.

custom_id.description: An identifier that can be provided for your own records.  (i.e.-Company load number) This field can be used to retrieve loads via GET.  This value must be unique. Custom Id's can have a maximum of 25 characters.

destination_city.description: Delivery location city of load/truck. For truck type entries this field is optional or can be used to specify a region.

destination_state.description: Delivery location state of load/truck. For truck type entries this field is optional.

full_load.description: The load will be assumed to be full if this argument isn't included and marked to true.

origin_city.description: Origin city location of load or truck.  Required for all entry types.

origin_state.description: Origin state location of load or truck.  Use the 2 digit state abbreviation.

other_trailer_types.description: Can be used to specify custom trailer types.

pay_rate.description: This field will accept either the per mile rate, or gross rate.

phone_extension.description: If not provided we will use the contact info associated with the users profile.

phone_number.description: If not provided we will use the contact info associated with the users profile.

receive_date.description: The date the load/truck should deliver.

ship_date.description: When posting loads this is the date the load should be picked up.  When posting trucks this is the date the truck is available to be loaded.

trailer_type.description: This can have 1 or more standard trailer types.

custom_id.description:
An identifier that can be provided for your own records. (i.e.-Company load number) This field can be used to retrieve loads via GET. This value must be unique.
You cannot update a custom_id once it is set. Please delete and reenter the load to change the custom_id.  Either posting_id or custom_id is required.

full_load.description: This should only be used with loads.

origin_city.description: Origin city location of load or truck

origin_state.description: Origin state location of load or truck

other_trailer_types.description: Can be used to specify custom trailer types.

phone_extension.description: If not provided we will use the contact info associated with the users profile.

phone_number.description: If not provided we will use the contact info associated with the users profile.

A unique id for each entry.  This value is returned via GET. 
Either posting_id or custom_id is required.

ship_date.description: When posting loads this is the date the load should be picked up.  When posting trucks this is the date the truck is available to be loaded.

trailer_type.description: This can have 1 or more standard trailer types.

contact_name.description: This is generated from the logged in users profile information.

custom_id.description: A unique identifier a user can provide for their own records.

origin_city.description: Origin city location of load or truck

origin_state.description: Origin state location of load or truck.

pay_rate.description: We expect one of 2 formats. either the per mile, or total sum.

phone_extension.description: If not supplied and not in the user's profile this will be null.

phone_number.description: If not supplied, this is generated from the logged in users profile information.

posting_id.description: This is the unique ID of this post.

receive_date.description: The date the load/truck should deliver.

ship_date.description: The date you wish the load to be shipped.

trailer_type.description: This can have 1 or more standard trailer types.

message.description: An explanation of what each code means.

description.description: An explanation of what each code means.

create_missing_account.description: If true the endpoint will create the users account in case it doesnt already exist.

service.description: Takes a social login service name,

token.description: The token returned by the social login service. For Google the value expected is :  data.code For Facebook the value expected is :  data.authResponse.accessToken For Apple the value expected is :  data.detail.authorization.id_token

email.description: The email address that was used to login.

end-user-token.description: On success and end-user-token is returned.

new_account.description: Indicates if a new account was created or an existing one was used to login.

entry_id.description: The entry that need to be toggled.

trailer_type.description: These are the officially supported trailer types.
